sect1.title: Connecting from XChat
sect1.para: Question: I have set up ctrlproxy, but nothing happens when I connect to it via the XChat client.

Answer: You can't manually connect to ctrlproxy. The password needs to be sent before the NICK and USER gets implemented. If you open a new server tab and connect to ctrlproxy with "/server", NICK and USER will get sent before you can manually send "/pass".

To connect to ctrlproxy via XChat, you will need to create a server entry where the "Server Password" field lists the password given in your ctrlproxyrc file. Then use the server list to connect to the ctrlproxy. It should then connect and connect to the channel(s) you listed for that server.

sect1.title: Supported operating systems
sect1.para: Question: On what operating systems does ctrlproxy run?
Answer: It has been tested with most major Linux distributions and FreeBSD. However, it should run on pretty much every OS that is POSIX-compatible.
